text: Zero's an online accounting platform so
we're really about trying to enable
small businesses to complete the error
accounting requirements
quickly and efficiently so we did a
migration onto AWS in 2016 we decided to
build our own simple platform based on
ec2 one of the things moving on to ec2
as we needed to be aware of our sequel
server licensing as you as you do with
any provider really and there were a
number of options available to us so we
started off with dedicated instances but
sidled very quickly on dedicated hosts
and we realized that we would rather pay
for the physical core licensing rather
than the virtual license option when
licensing sequel server using the ec2
platform gives us a lot of flexibility
around spinning up to cope with demand
so when those businesses need to
complete interview tax requirements we
can scale a platform up as appropriate
to assist them up there we had about 500
application servers running in our
previous hosting provider and we were
able to shift onto 5,000 in the new
environment they don't really allowed us
to focus on right sizing those
application servers so we could have a
lot larger number of smaller application
servers which again really helped with
our scaling story
the migration enabled us to save about
30 percent of our sequel server
licensing costs and that should really
be considered against the background of
the fact that we're we're always growing
so we're able to reduce our licensing
costs and continues to support growth of
our customer base during their time I
think that's a really really compelling
story
